scheduler

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Event>

    public class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Event>
    Encapsulates an Event. Contains methods for extracting date from string input. Date format is strictly "MM/dd/yyyy" References: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/999172/how-to-parse-a-date https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Date.html
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isDateStringValid

        public static boolean isDateStringValid(java.lang.String dateString)
        Signals whether passed date string is correctly formatted and refers to a real date.
        Parameters:
        dateString - String representation of the date.
        Returns:
        True only if date string is formatted correctly and date exists.

      • parseDateString

        Parses date from formatted string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Date only if parsing is successful and date exists.
